Name: flattened rice / poha
Describe: dehusked rice which is flattened into flat light dry flakes, these flakes of rice swell when added to liquid, whether hot or cold, as they absorb water, milk, or any other liquids. the thicknesses of these flakes vary between almost translucently thin (the more expensive varieties) to nearly four times thicker than a normal rice grain.

Name: puffed rice
Describe: grain made from rice; usually made by heating rice kernels under high pressure in the presence of steam, though the method of manufacture varies widely. pori (puffed rice) has been mentioned in various tamil literatures as an offering to hindu deities. offerings of pori and jaggery made to vinayagar (lord ganesh) are mentioned in the tiruppugazh, a 15th-century anthology of tamil religious songs, written by tamil poet arunagirinathar. pori is offered to hindu gods and goddesses in all poojas in the south indian states of kerala and tamil nadu.
